texto: 5.3.1 Organizations When an organization, as a whole or a part, enters into an agreement, it is sometimes called a “party” to the agreement. Parties can be from the same organization or from separate organizations. An organization can be as small as a single individual, if the individual is assigned responsibilities and authorities. In informal terms, the organization that is responsible for executing a process is sometimes referred to by the name of that process. For example, the organization executing the Acquisition process is sometimes called the “acquirer”. Other examples include supplier, implementer, maintainer, and operator.
